title: The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword
image: The Legend of Zelda Skyward Sword.jpg
description: "It's time we conclude our necessary companionship."

title: F-Zero GX
description: You got boost power!

title: Super Smash Bros. Melee
description: The first game that I ever played. It was hard to find a kid that didn't play it.

title: Viewtiful Joe
description: Just go for it!

title: Viewtiful Joe 2
description: Just go for it!... again.

title: Scooby-Doo Night of 100 Frights
description: We've all wanted to try a Scooby-Snack... right?

title: Rayman 3: Hoodlum Havoc
description: Rayman's attempt at being cool. As a kid... it was kind of cool.

title: Mario Party 8
description: Flick Wii remote = Win. That didn't stop my friends and I from having fun.

title: Super Mario Galaxy
description: Contains music that will be engrained into my head forever. A highly enjoyable game too, I suppose.

title: Super Mario Galaxy 2
description: Unlike its predecessor, this game embraced course-based design. It was a more focused experience.

title: Advance Wars: Days of Ruin
description: My first foray into strategy games. At ~10 years old, I was pretty bad.

title: Pokemon Battle Revolution
description: Regular Pokemon Battles. No revolution here.

title: Pokemon XD: Gale of Darkness
description: Memorable for its dark tone and setting as a Pokemon game.

title: Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks
description: Lots of fun memories trying to beat this with my sister.

title: Wario World
description: A well-made platformer for Mario's greedy nemesis.

title: NFL Street
description: An attempt by the NFL and EA to be "hardcore". 90's kids love it!

title: The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords Adventures
image: The Legend of Zelda Four Swords Adventures.jpg
description: Four heroes of time, one adventure.

title: Dark Cloud 2
description: This belonged to my sister. It was cool, but she didn't like it that much.

title: New Super Mario Bros. U
description: This is a Mario game. Yes, that's right. A Mario game. Could you tell?

title: Animal Crossing: City Folk
description: Not the most exciting Animal Crossing, but worth it for the music alone.

title: Bayonetta 2
description: Bayonetta but with an annoying escort mission here and there. Still a great game.

title: The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker
image: The Legend of Zelda Wind Waker.jpg
description: My favorite Legend of Zelda world. The art style is timeless.

title: Super Paper Mario
description: Less RPG; more engaging story, characters, and world.

title: Astral Chain
description: An action game that's all about world building. The police station music is a complete jam.

title: Soul Calibur II
description: Wait, you can play as Link? This Voldo guy is weird.

title: Kirby Air Ride
description: Never played the main game because me and my sister loved Freeride mode so much.

title: Resident Evil 0
description: The train sequence was good... and then the bugs attacked. And the monkeys. There are zombies in this game?

title: Freekstyle
description: It's freeky freeky, but why not freaky freaky?

title: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
image: The Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild.jpg
description: A modern take on the original Legend of Zelda on NES. Each player will come away from this game with a different story to tell.

title: Resident Evil (REmake)
description: I was afraid to touch the box for this game as a kid because I thought it was cursed...

title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
description: A celebration of video games.

title: Splatoon 2
description: Spla2oon is the most family friendly shooter I've ever had the pleasure of playing.

title: Super Mario Odyssey
description: Each world is creative and packed with detail. My favorite type of Mario game taken to an extreme.

title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons
description: Undeniably the best game in my favorite series. It's so good that I had to let it go.

title: Dr. Muto
description: I learned what an isotope was from this game. Basically Dr. Muto helped me pass chemistry.

title: Starfox Adventures
description: Not a Starfox game, but it is an adventure game. The graphics blew me away as a kid.

title: The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker HD
image: The Legend of Zelda The Wind Waker HD.jpg
description: It's The Wind Waker... but in HD! The new orchestral soundtrack makes it worth the existence.

title: Dragon's Lair 3D: Return to the Lair
image: Dragon's Lair 3D Return to the Lair.jpg
description: I never played this, however it reminds me of Shrek because Shrek and Donkey go to the Dragon's Lair in the movie.

title: I-Ninja
description: I loved this game as a kid. It was very difficult, and it taught me about the Karate belt color system.

title: Marvel vs. Capcom 2
description: ♫ I wanna take you for a ride. ♫

title: Blood Omen 2
description: My sister enjoyed this game. It scared me a bit as a kid, then Twilight came out and made vampires un-scary again.

title: Pokemon: SoulSilver Version
description: A remake of Generation 2 Pokemon games. Chikorita is the cutest starter pokemon. I'm a leaf-type kind of person.

title: Harvest Moon: A Wonderful Life
description: I saw my cousin playing this when we used to sleep over at my grandma's house as a kid. To this day I love simulation games.

title: Mega Man Legends
description: I probably never got past the first couple of levels. It was good, but I've always preferred traditional Mega Man games.

title: Spider-Man
description: In a time when comic books were still the main source of superhero content, this game may be the reason I got into Spider-Man.

title: Spider-Man 2: Enter Electro
description: The Playstation's render distance was tiny, so you could only see the tops of buildings... an abyss waits below.

title: NBA Street Vol. 2
description: This was a fun take on the "hardcore" sports trend of the mid-2000s.

title: Super Mario All-Stars Limited Edition
description: The Wii release of Super Mario All-Stars. It's all of the classic Mario games, but with updated visuals.

title: Tony Hawk's Underground 2
description: This game took its humor from the Jackass movies of the time. Immature, sure, but the gameplay was addicting.

title: Street Fighter Alpha 3
description: I sucked at fighting games as a child. I suck at fighting games as an adult.

title: Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee
description: Both children and adults can enjoy this game for its mix of goofy characters, dark humor, and social commentary.

title: Hotwheels Velocity X
description: The X in the name makes it sound cool. That's because it was cool! (I was a Hotwheels kid.)

title: 1080 Avalanche
description: A snowboarding game with a greater focus on racing than doing tricks.

title: SSX Tricky
description: A snowboarding game with a greater focus on tricks than on racing.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Duelists of the Roses
image: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Duelists of the Roses.jpg
description: I loved Yu-Gi-Oh! as a kid, yet somehow didn't play this game much. I had way too many Dark Magician cards.

title: Godzilla: Destroy All Monsters Melee
description: The game that made me fall in love with Godzilla. Who doesn't like to watch big monsters beat each other up?

title: The Spongebob Squarepants Movie
description: The Spongebob Squarepants Movie: The Game.

title: Alien Hominid
description: You can bite peoples' heads off in this game. It's okay though because you can also wear cute hats.

title: Pokemon Colosseum
description: You can choose between Espeon or Umbreon. I chose Umbreon because dark-mode > light-mode.

title: Metroid Prime
description: A perfect example of how to take a series into a new perspective (2D Action-Platformer to 3D First-Person-Shooter).

title: Resident Evil 4
description: If I had to choose only one game to live with the rest of my life, it would be this one. I can play it over and over and over.

title: Pitfall: The Lost Expedition
description: Pitfall! was the original Pitfall game on the Atari 2600. That's the only one you need to know about.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Nightmare Troubadour
description: The one Yu-Gi-OH! game that I actually played. A lot. I loved collecting cards, especially because it didn't cost real money.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3
description: If only you could do sick combos when skateboarding in real life.

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
description: Michelangelo was my favorite because I liked the color orange... Nowadays I appreciate Leo being the level-headed one.

title: The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass
image: The Legend of Zelda Phantom Hourglass.jpg
description: The first handheld Zelda game that I played. It was okay. It was nice to see the Wind Waker artstyle and world again.

title: Donkey Kong Jungle Beat
description: Bongo peripherals included. A fun game, but after hours of hitting the bongos to the beat, my hands were destroyed.

title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
image: Prince of Persia The Sands of Time.jpg
description: The time rewind mechanic blew me away when I first played it. It was a creative alternative to the standard death-state.

title: Mega Man X5
description: A Mega Man game where you don't have to play as Mega Man. Good thing Zero is a fun character too.

title: Extreme-G 3
description: There's an Extreme-G 1 and 2?

title: Maximo: Ghosts to Glory
description: It took me far too long to realize that this game is related to the Ghosts and Goblins series.

title: Tak and The Power of Juju
image: Tak and The Power of Juju.jpg
description: Good juju.

title: Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus
image: Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus.jpg
description: I appreciated this series for its focus on stealth and problem-solving. It was fresh for its time.

title: Pokemon Dash
description: Pokemon Dash to the polls.

title: Kya: Dark Lineage
description: My sister's game. Games with strong female protagonists were even more rare than they are today.

title: Nicktoons UNITE
description: Reminds me of a simpler time when I would watch way too much Nickelodean.

title: Batman: Vengeance
description: When Batman wasn't very dark at all. I like Batman media with dark tones, but the lighter comic tone is great too.

title: War of the Monsters
description: Giant monsters from the pantheon of giant monsters smash things. Sign me up.

title: The Hobbit
description: If I could live in Hobbiton, I would.

title: True Crime: Streets of LA
description: Grand Theft Auto for kids who couldn't convince their parents to let them play Grand Theft Auto.

title: X-Men: Next Dimension
description: The X-Men are great fighting game characters. Just look at Marvel vs. Capcom.

title: Disney's Magical Mirror Starring Mickey Mouse
image: Disney's Magical Mirror Starring Mickey Mouse.jpg
description: This game was magical as a kid. I've always enjoyed the creative settings of Mickey Mouse games.

title: NBA Courtside 2002
description: A sports-simulation game. Never played it. I'm a big nerd.

title: Gamecube Preview Disc
description: Featured demos and videos for various Gamecube games. Billy Hatcher and Splinter Cell demos were my favorite.

title: NFL Blitz 20-02
description: A sports game I can get behind. No simulation here, just a whole lot of fun.

title: Lego Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy
image: Lego Star Wars II The Original Trilogy.jpg
description: Lego games are always filled with charm. My sister and I loved unlocking all the characters.

title: Sly 2: Band of Thieves
description: This sequel made the Sly Cooper world more expansive while retaining the quality of the first.

title: Tom and Jerry in War of the Whiskers
image: Tom and Jerry in War of the Whiskers.jpg
description: A fun arena-style fighting game with Tom and Jerry characters. The kind of game you play in the dentist's waiting room.

title: Spyro: Enter the Dragonfly
description: Spyro before Activision figured out how to turn the franchise into a toy generator.

title: Turok: Evolution
description: Velociraptors are scary, yo.

title: Destroy All Humans 2
description: Just in case you missed a few.

title: Peter Jackson's King Kong: The Official Game of the Movie
image: Peter Jackson's King Kong The Official Game of the Movie.jpg
description: A surprisingly good game for a movie tie-in. Giant centipedes are scary.

title: Marvel Nemesis: Rise of the Imperfects
image: Marvel Nemesis Rise of the Imperfects.jpg
description: I actually played the PSP version more. Both versions were extremely difficult as a kid...  and probably still are.

title: Jak II
description: The start of Naughty Dog's journey towards cinematic experiences.

title: Disney's PK: Out of the Shadows
image: Disney's PK Out of the Shadows.jpg
description: Apparently Donald Duck has a superhero alias named Paperinik. That's what the PK stands for. The more you know.

title: Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg
image: Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg.jpg
description: Sonic Team's attempt at making another Sonic-type mascot. It didn't work. The game, however, is charming and creative.

title: Pokemon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time
image: Pokemon Mystery Dungeon Explorers of Time.jpg
description: Not a traditional Pokemon game, but the story and multitude of Pokemon RPG-companions kept me engaged.

title: Monster Hunter 4: Ultimate
description: My first Monster Hunter game. It was good, but it has an overwhelming learning curve.

title: Animal Crossing: New Leaf
description: The first Animal Crossing game to let you substantially edit your town.

title: Rhythm Heaven Megamix
description: Wubba-dubba-dub, is that true?

title: Mario & Luigi: Partners in Time
description: A game borrowed between me and my elementary school friend. I don't remember who it belonged to, but it got lost. :(

title: 007: Nightfire
description: Hours and hours of playing hide-and-seek with my cousins on the huge ski-lift map in split-screen multiplayer.

title: Luigi's Mansion
description: Luigi finally stars in a quality game. The atmosphere is surprisingly spooky for a game in the Mario universe.

title: Animal Crossing
description: I will never forget my time spent playing this game as a child. It helped shape me as a person.
